attribs.description: Has money to pay for chores.
attribs.name: Pays for Odd Jobs

characters.description: Will pay a modest salary for chores.
characters.name: Uncle

characters.description: An NPC. You can still control her actions, though, if she is needed in the woods later to rescue Suzy. After viewing this character the first time, press the key shown in brackets [ ] to return to Home. For mobile users, just tap on Home.
characters.name: Mom

characters.description: This is your player character for the scenario. Under Player in the upper right hand corner, Change User ID to "Playing as Suzy". Then return Home. Once you're finished at Home and are ready to travel, take a look at the possible destinations to travel to. It looks like there's only one, initially listed as a location not yet visited, so select it and press Go. On arrival, the location's name is revealed, linked. Click on Sketchy-Path Forest for further instructions. * * * * * If you've finished getting bacon, then it's time to go back. Getting to the forest won't be a problem, but leaving it will be. If the event pops up, press Y to open. Otherwise, we'll still say the event happened, so make sure Suzy is in the forest and click on Travel Danger, either from the forest or the overview. Continue by following instructions for that event.
characters.name: Suzy

events.description: Set difficulty to Moderate, meaning the chance of getting lost or eaten by wolves in this particular forest is decent but not overwhelming. If Suzy is alone in the forest, select her name with stat 2 and press Add. Otherwise, use her Mother's stat. Then press Roll. Because she's tired after all those chores, play at a disadvantage, which means we take the worst of two rolls. So, remember the first result and then press Roll again. Actually, in this case, we need it to be a Minor Failure, so keep rolling until that happens. We'll take that to mean she's lost but there are no wolves or twisted ankles. To get out of this pickle, press O to return to the overview and go to the Connect to Service event.
events.name: Travel Danger

events.description: Suzy needs to call her Mother for help of some kind. Choose Easy difficulty since we won't be far from civilization, then roll. For a major success, Mother will explain to Suzy how to get home, meaning that she will arrive home without further incident. For a minor success, Mother can travel to the woods and lead Suzy out, using her higher Pathfinding skill so that Travel Danger has a better chance to succeed. For a single minor failure, Suzy can probably just try to call again (wouldn't you, if you were her?) But if things get worse, you might have to go to setup and add a Wolf character, then roll either Travel Danger or a new event such as Danger Interaction to see if it is close enough to be threatening. If push comes to shove, maybe she can grab a fallen branch to fend it off (set up as a new item), or climb a tree, or yell. This is the end of the walkthrough explanation. After returning home, Suzy can cook the bacon. Once the win condition described under Overall Settings is met, a green checkmark should show in the log on the overview page, indicating that the scenario is successfully completed.
events.name: Connect to Service

items.description: Suzy's mother is the first number on the contacts list.
items.name: Phone

items.description: This item functions as a crafting station, fixed at the Home location. Useful for producing items from recipes, namely, Cooked Bacon — go ahead and click on it.
items.name: Wood Stove

items.description: "0 / 30" means that although there are none yet, we can have up to 30 at a time. Looks like crafting requires Raw Bacon, but we do not start with any in stock. Where could that be found? Keep an eye out for possible sources as you investigate and travel. We'll also need the Wood Stove to cook the bacon, which means Suzy will need to be at home to do so. Notice that the Where column for the wood stove shows Home, indicating that it's currently available.
items.name: Cooked Bacon

items.description: A crafting station, similar to the Wood Stove.
items.name: Barn

items.description: The most efficient plan would be to raise more pigs before butchering them, by pressing Start on the row where pigs are the Source (as well as the result). However, let's do it the hard way this time. Go to Raw Bacon and start slaughtering! After you've dispensed of the original pair, it's time to get some cash to buy more. Click on Cash and then Chores to continue. When you've bought a new pair of pigs, reload the page to be able to raise more. It's not strictly necessary for the scenarioâ€”one is enough to finish the stack of Raw Bacon. Still, Uncle would probably want you to leave a pair for the future.
items.name: Pigs

items.description: In this scenario, Chores and Cash are general storage items (or universal), meaning that they can be used anywhere and don't have to be carried by a specific person. Press Start to do some chores. There's no limit to the chores that can be done, but you can only get paid for 10 at a time. Go to Cash to get your earnings.
items.name: Chores

items.description: Getting paid doesn't take any particular amount of time, so there's a Gain button instead of Start, but otherwise, it works the same. To get paid all at once, enter a higher number such as 11 — it won't do more than what you have available. If you don't have enough cash to buy a pig yet, go back to Chores and repeat this process. Also, of course, you'll need more than one pig in order to get baby pigs.
items.name: Cash

items.description: Now we can make use of that Knife Suzy has been carrying. There are 2 pigs currently at the farm. Press Start and wait while she turns both of them into neatly sized pieces of meat. If Suzy is not shown under Where as carrying the knife, you may need to go back to her screen and click on the knife to get to this raw bacon screen. Similarly, if the pigs are at the farm but not shown, navigate back to the farm and then click through the pigs to get here. Looks like we ran out. Go back to Pigs and see how to get more. Once you have a full load of raw bacon (30), it's time for Suzy to start the perilous trip back home. Navigate to her page to do so.
items.name: Raw Bacon

locations.description: First, take a look around. Click on her Mom and then Suzy to see that both have Pathfinding, but Suzy's is lower. This means she'll be more likely to get lost or have other trouble in events that may happen in the woods if her Mom isn't there. Also, right-click on the Wood Stove to open it in a new tab. After finishing those instructions, close the tab to return to this page. Next, it's time to explore. The only destination we can get to from home shows Somewhere not yet visited, meaning we don't know anything about it yet. Bring up Suzy's page again to travel.
locations.name: Home

locations.description: The notable thing about this forest is the Travel Danger event. There is a chance of automatically triggering while character travel from (not to) this area is in progress. Since there is no delay on the way to Uncle's Farm, the event will not trigger yet. Go ahead and bring Suzy to the farm if you haven't done so. Then continue with the instructions described under Uncle's Farm.
locations.name: Sketchy-Path Forest

locations.description: Hopefully, you immediately recognized that Pigs mean bacon, which is what we're after. Click on them to continue.
locations.name: Uncle's Farm

overall.description: After trying the first scenario, consider going through this guided tour to learn more about how the game works. Same story but with detailed instructions and explanations, in lieu of a help section. Begin by clicking on the Home location and following the instructions.
overall.title: Bacon for Dinner – Walkthrough
